meanings.sent1: After the long journey, I needed to start replenishing my energy by resting.
meanings.sent2: She replenished the bird feeder with fresh seeds every morning.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy was replenishing its energy by napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The rain replenished the dry soil, bringing life back to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The chef was replenishing the buffet table with delicious treats for the guests.

meanings.sent1: I had to start replenishing my savings after spending too much on vacation.
meanings.sent2: The baker replenished the bread shelves with warm loaves every hour.
meanings.sent3: The student was replenishing their knowledge by reviewing the lesson before the test.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter replenished the room, filling it with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The artist was replenishing the colors on his palette to continue painting the masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Restore (something) to its former level or condition.
meanings.sent1: The rain helped replenish the river, bringing it back to its normal level.
meanings.sent2: He replenished his strength by eating a nutritious meal after the workout.
meanings.sent3: The magician was replenishing the empty hat with a rabbit for the next trick.
meanings.sent4: Her smile replenished his heart, making him feel whole again.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was replenishing the old car, restoring it to its former glory.
